content: the court of appeals in naples issued a final ruling on an appeal brought by the parties involved in a legal case the court partially reformed the original judgment dissolving the existing community and ordering the division of the land and building among the heirs they also ordered a minimum cash adjustment to be paid the court rejected the second ground of appeal and confirmed the judgment on the counterclaim the case originated from a lawsuit filed by one party against a married couple seeking the nullity of a private agreement and the division of assets the defendants filed a counterclaim seeking reimbursement for improvements made to the property after going through several stages including the appointment of experts and the submission of evidence the court ruled in favor of the plaintiff ordering the division of the property and reimbursement for expenses incurred for improvements the defendants appealed the decision but the court rejected their arguments and upheld the original judgment with some modifications the court also ordered both parties to bear their own costs the ruling was made on february 5 2021 and filed with the court registry on march 2 2021

metadata.CASE_ID: Corte appello Napoli sez. VI, 02/03/2021, n.767
